The professor, Dr. Mehra, known for his penchant for challenging problems, had included a question that sent ripples of consternation through the student body.
normalised: On the morning of sixteenth august two thousand and twenty four, a minor kerfuffle erupted at I-I-T Delhi's mathematics department, all thanks to a particularly tricky Linear Algebra exam. The professor, Doctor Mehra, known for his penchant for challenging problems, had included a question that sent ripples of consternation through the student body.

unnormalised: The problem, reportedly involving a 5x5 matrix and the computation of its eigenvalues, proved to be a significant hurdle. Several students, already running on fumes after pulling all-nighters, struggled to apply the theorems learned throughout the semester. "I spent almost 45 mins on that one question," lamented Rohan Sharma, a third-year student. "Dr. Mehra always manages to stump us."
